headline: UK Will Consider Further Relaxing Rules on London Banker Bonuses
summary: (Bloomberg) -- The UK will consider ditching more restrictions on banker bonuses as the country looks for ways to become more competitive on the global financial stage. The Prudential Regulation Authority and the Financial Conduct Authority could shorten the waiting period for top managers to get their bonuses to five years, down from as long as eight years, according to a consultation published on Tuesday. For other key risk-takers, it might be shortened to four years. “We should not return to
